subject: RE: [junit] How to automate the testcases!
msgSnippet: I know you re looking for the other man s response, but here is mine. I would write a test for every negative case I thought I would reasonably be able to
messageBody:
I know you're looking for the other man's response, but here is mine.

I would write a test for every negative case I thought I would
reasonably be able to handle, then add some generic code to "handle"
remaining cases (sure as propagating exceptions upward in the stack or
throwing an unchecked exception). The key is to try to write a single
JUnit test case for each boundary condition.

As always, I would use my judgment -- and that's why I'm a professional
programmer and not a factory programmer. :)
